comment: Download the data from the given URL. Uploading a local file will adjust this step automatically.
Ensures the data is processed as UTF8, even if it's originally using a different character set.
Outputs each line of the CSV as JavaScript object for further processing. The header names are used as JavaScript property names in the output.
Log the first and last object before transforming.

Transform each record into the unified accessibility-cloud format. Each attribute in `mappings` is transformed using a JavaScript string.

Note that the output of this unit must at least have the following attributes: `geometry`, `properties-originalId`, `properties-name`, `properties-category`, and `properties-accessibility-accessibleWith-wheelchair`.

`geometry` must be a valid [GeoJSON geometry object](http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#geometry-objects).

`properties-originalId` must be an ID that is unique over the whole dataset of this source. If you do not have a unique ID in the dataset, it's best to use a combination of other attributes of the place that change rarely, for example name + address.

If provided, the `properties-infoPageUrl` property is used as backlink to your website.
Log the first and last JSON after transforming.
Insert or update each transformed place. For recognizing/overwriting previously imported places, the `properties-originalId` is used.
